item.title: Behind the scenes of the Gang of 8
item.description: The legislation comes after weeks of tense meetings. The deal required painful compromises.

item.description: Since 9/11, terrorism has gone from an issue that unifies to one that divides.

item.description: Politicians prepare for Americans to ask again what government can do to prevent acts of terrorism.

item.description: He expresses optimism about the future of immigration reform.

item.title: Senate to vote Wednesday on gun control
item.description: It will require 60 votes to pass, and the White House and Democrats still lack the final votes they need.

item.description: Obama calls the events an "act of terror" and plans to visit the city on for an interfaith service.

item.description: Jenny Sanford filed a lawsuit alleging that her husband was at her home.

item.description: The Boston Marathon bombings have Congress seemingly paralyzed.

item.description: Dangerous mail was postmarked Memphis, Tenn.

item.description: The government does have a means of shutting down wireless communications.

item.description: "We will find the perpretrators and bring them to justice. That I guarantee," he says.

item.description: Opinion: Our colleagues need to admit that there is a real hazard to society.

item.description: Opinion: Prices will drop when the industry stops obstructing a change mandated by law.

item.description: Counterterrorism adviser Lisa Monaco's twin brother couldn't be found immediately after the blasts.

item.description: The country becomes the 13th in the world to legalize same-sex marriage.

item.description: The president isn't backing the continuation of measures that keep dozens of benefits in place.
